attachments.title: Trading platforms curb trading on high-flying Reddit stocks
attachments.text: It limits access to traders that have contributed to the wild activity in stocks like GameStop.
attachments.fallback: Axios: Trading platforms curb trading on high-flying Reddit stocks

text: Capital Bank handles most of the clearing for robinhood and lot of the traffic for other retail stock trading platforms as well. They also bailed out Marvin. Straight up manipulation and conflict of interest.

elements.text: Capital Bank handles most of the clearing for robinhood and lot of the traffic for other retail stock trading platforms as well. They also bailed out Marvin. Straight up manipulation and conflict of interest.

text: Just start your own brokerage firm / stock-trading firm :slightly_smiling_face: easy \s

elements.text: Just start your own brokerage firm / stock-trading firm

text: I dunno am I the only one that thinks the stock exchanges should suspend trading for the time being on these stocks?  All this is is a pump and dump scheme wrapped in smash-the-power political rhetoric

elements.text: I dunno am I the only one that thinks the stock exchanges should suspend trading for the time being on these stocks?  All this is is a pump and dump scheme wrapped in smash-the-power political rhetoric

text: suspending trading for too long can cause liquidity shocks

elements.text: suspending trading for too long can cause liquidity shocks

text: and its badly informed rhetoric at that.. it's never been a better time to be a retail investor, you can get a good price easily now, compared to 10 or 20 or 30 years ago

elements.text: and its badly informed rhetoric at that.. it's never been a better time to be a retail investor, you can get a good price easily now, compared to 10 or 20 or 30 years ago

text: and shorting in general is a huge benefit to making prices accurate

elements.text: and shorting in general is a huge benefit to making prices accurate

text:
While I agree that there is a lot of political rhetoric. People are upset about hypocrisy.

Certain institutions have been manipulating stocks for years behind closed doors. Why can't a public social media platform do the same?

I don't have a dime in stocks but it sends a message out to people that: getting rich off of stocks is only for those well off and with connections.

elements.text:
While I agree that there is a lot of political rhetoric. People are upset about hypocrisy.

Certain institutions have been manipulating stocks for years behind closed doors. Why can't a public social media platform do the same?

I don't have a dime in stocks but it sends a message out to people that: getting rich off of stocks is only for those well off and with connections.

text: the fantasy land these people imagine where hedge funds don't short poorly run companies is not the utopia they think it is

elements.text: the fantasy land these people imagine where hedge funds don't short poorly run companies is not the utopia they think it is

text: the only people who consistently make over-market returns are our dear leaders in congress, somehow, because they are super smart I guess

text: Rules for thee not for me

elements.text: Rules for thee not for me

text: To be fair, I have about 300 bucks in GME right now — so I’ve not really bought into the hype fully. I do think it’s interesting to observe this event, and the possibility that it might happen again (or in a different incarnation) as more people turn a discerning eye on the market and share the information as quickly as possible.

elements.text: To be fair, I have about 300 bucks in GME right now — so I’ve not really bought into the hype fully. I do think it’s interesting to observe this event, and the possibility that it might happen again (or in a different incarnation) as more people turn a discerning eye on the market and share the information as quickly as possible.

text: its a fun game sure but anyone buying now is going to lose all their money unless they manage to sell it to some other chump who will lose the money

text: I bought a share today at 380 for giggles. It ran up for awhile but then I sold it for a 40 cents loss. Totally rekt.
